feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 21 at 4:55AM AKDT until October 21 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Central Arctic Plains and Central Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 10:32PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm With Heavy Snow and Blowing Snow Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night... A strong storm moving into the Western Bering and Chukchi Seas on Sunday will move along the West Coast of Alaska on Monday. This will bring a mix of rain and snow and south winds 30 mph gusting to 50 mph to the West Coast of Alaska west of Golovin and

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 10:32PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm With High Surf Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night... South winds of 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph over the Bering and Chukchi Seas on Sunday will spread to the West Coast of Alaska Sunday night into Monday. This will bring the possibility of high surf and minor coastal flooding to the West Coast of Alaska from

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 21 at 2:58AM PDT until October 21 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf of 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet. entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 21 at 9:25AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to continue slowly falling through Minor Flood Stage into next week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 21 at 11:14AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWEST AND WESTCENTRAL GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS .. Relative humidity values of 25 percent or less and west winds will gust up to 25 MPH this afternoon. With very dry fuels, high fire danger conditions can be expected.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 21 at 4:28AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Very High Cropland Fire Danger Today... Increasing northwest winds may gust over 35 mph at times today. These winds combined with very dry cropland fuels will lead to the potential for rapid fire growth should fires start in these areas. Avoid burning if possible today and limit any ignition sources including properly disposing of cigarettes. If harvesting today,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Black Hawk; Bremer; Butler; Cerro Gordo; Davis; Franklin; Grundy; Hamilton; Hancock; Hardin; Jasper; Mahaska; Marion; Marshall; Poweshiek; Tama; Wapello; Wright

entry.summary: ...Very High Cropland Fire Danger Today... Gusty northwest winds are expected today, with gusts up to 40 mph possible later this morning through the afternoon hours. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 20 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE ACTION DAY... The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an Ozone Action Day for the Austin area for Saturday, October 21, 2023. Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing high levels of ozone air pollution in the Austin area on Saturday.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 20 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 7 PM CDT SATURDAY... The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality is forecasting a Code Orange Air Quality Alert, from 7 AM to 7 PM CDT Saturday. entry.cap:areaDesc: Hardin; Lower Jefferson; Northern Orange; Southern Orange; Upper Jefferson
